definitions.definition: To cause strain or anxiety to someone.
To retain someone’s property against the payment of a debt; to distrain.
To treat a new object to give it an appearance of age.
definitions.example: She distressed the new media cabinet so that it fit with the other furniture in the room.
I'm distressed that John hasn't answered my calls. I hope nothing bad happened to him on the way here.

definitions.definition: (of a property) offered for sale after foreclosure
(of furniture, etc.) faded or abused in order to appear old, or antique
